revised_title: Harold Spencer Jones: A Pioneering Astronomer
tldr: Harold Spencer Jones was a renowned British astronomer who made significant contributions to the field of astronomy. He determined an improved value of the solar parallax using observations of the minor planet Eros, which led to a more accurate understanding of the solar system. Jones also played a crucial role in the move of the Royal Observatory from Greenwich to Herstmonceux and the decision to build the Isaac Newton telescope. He was awarded the Gold Medal of the Royal Astronomical Society and a Royal Medal of the Royal Society for his work.
